security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only educational content about PCI DSS compliance. No executable scripts, filesystem access, environment access, network calls, or code execution capabilities exist. All code snippets are illustrative examples within markdown documentation.

content.user_title: Implement PCI DSS compliance for payment systems
content.value_statement: Payment teams risk noncompliance when card data handling is unclear. This skill provides PCI DSS requirements and practical safeguards for secure processing.
actual_capabilities: Summarizes the 12 PCI DSS core requirements
Explains PCI compliance levels and assessment types
Lists prohibited and allowed card data storage with masking guidance
Provides tokenization guidance using payment processor tokens
Shows encryption at rest and TLS configuration examples
Outlines access control, audit logging, and compliance checklists
limitations: No automated scanning or validation of real systems
No direct integration with payment processor APIs
Does not provide legal certification or PCI attestation
Examples may need updates for future PCI DSS revisions

use_cases.title: Define PCI scope
use_cases.description: Identify which systems touch card data and reduce scope with hosted payments or tokenization.

use_cases.title: Build audit checklist
use_cases.description: Map PCI requirements to access control, logging, encryption, and testing tasks.

use_cases.title: Design payment flow
use_cases.description: Apply tokenization and masking guidance to avoid storing sensitive card data.

prompt_templates.title: PCI basics
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the 12 PCI DSS requirements and which ones apply to a hosted checkout flow.

prompt_templates.title: Storage rules
prompt_templates.prompt: List prohibited card data and allowed fields, plus safe masking guidance.

prompt_templates.title: Tokenization plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Describe a server side flow that uses payment tokens and avoids handling card numbers.

prompt_templates.title: Audit readiness
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PCI readiness checklist for access control, logging, encryption, and testing.

output_examples.input: Give me a PCI DSS readiness checklist for a small ecommerce site
output: Use hosted checkout or tokenization to avoid storing card data
Encrypt any stored PAN and mask display outputs
Restrict access to card data by role and log all access
Enforce TLS 1.2 or higher for all payment traffic
Run vulnerability scans and maintain patching process

best_practices: Minimize card data exposure by using hosted payments or tokens
Encrypt PAN at rest and enforce TLS for all transmissions
Log and review access to cardholder data regularly
anti_patterns: Storing CVV, track data, or PIN under any circumstances
Sending raw card details to backend services
Using default passwords on payment system components

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It is a text based skill and works on Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and examples but does not certify compliance or scan systems.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Stripe or other processors?
faq.answer: It describes tokenization flows but does not perform integrations or API calls.

faq.question: Does it collect or store my data?
faq.answer: No. It contains documentation only and has no data collection logic.

faq.question: What should I do if guidance seems unclear?
faq.answer: Check official PCI DSS documents and follow your assessor guidance.

faq.question: How does this compare to a compliance audit tool?
faq.answer: This is educational guidance, while audit tools test real systems and produce evidence.
